result.execSummary:
The defendant Craig A. Karaba was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of a controlled substance., an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Craig A. Karaba
parties.address: PO Box 83, 813 Meridian St, Curtiss, WI 54422

supervisions.notes: Defendant was ordered to report immediately to the probation and parole office.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant is ordered to pay the DNA surcharge, and to make arrangements to provide a DNA sample, within 48 hours, for testing through the Clark County Sheriff Department or if on probation, to the Department of Corrections as is required in all criminal convictions.  Fine and/or costs to be paid on a schedule established by the agent.
2/2/2017 AMENDED  to add Attorney fees, as ordered by the Court
Defendant shall attend counseling, treatments, programming, evaluations as deemed appropriate by the agent releasing all records to the agent upon request

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol, and not go into places that sell alcohol except incidentally such as a grocery store, convenience store or gas station or other such place where alcohol is not sold for consumption on the premises.
Defendant shall not possess or consume any medication or drug except as may be specifically prescribed by a medical professional for defendant, and then shall be taken only as prescribed.
Expunction can be applied for if defendant successfully completes probation and all financial obligations are paid in full.

The defendant shall pay Department of Correction fees as directed by the agent.
The defendant shall submit to random urine/PBT testing as required by the agent or any law enforcement officer.

The defendant is to submit to an Alcohol and Other Drug Assessment (AODA) and follow the recommendations, releasing the findings to the agent, if defendant has already finished this assessment he is to release all findings to his agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
